  • CLine2D ()
    Default constructor, line point defaults to (0,0) and direction to (1,0).

  • CLine2D (CPoint2D< T > P, CVector2D< T > Dir)

  • CLine2D< T > & operator= (const CLine2D< T > &Line2D)
    Overloading of assignment operator.

  • const CVector2D< T > & GetDir () const

  • const CPoint2D< T > & GetPoint () const
    Returns the point used to define the line.

  • bool Intersect (const CLine2D< T > &L, CPoint2D< T > &Q)
    Calculates the intersection between line L1 and line L2, if the lines does not intersect, the middle point on the line defined by the two closest points on each line is returned in Q.

  • bool Set (const CPoint2D< T > &P, const CVector2D< T > &Dir)

  • CVector2D< T > m_Dir
    defines the 2D direction of line

Detailed Description

template<class T>
class ipl::CLine2D< T >

A class defining a 2 dimensional line by a 2D point and a direction vector, last updated 7/2/2001.

The template type should be a floating point, i.e. type float or double. To iterate a line in an image use CGraphics::Line() instead, to draw a line in an image see CStdImage::DrawLine().

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
0.5, by ivb@mip.sdu.dk and edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
Ivar Balslev and René Dencker Eriksen
